summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, providing the password for a drive containing discovery materials in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It is a procedural document related to evidence sharing in the criminal prosecution.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery materials are being shared.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The signatory of the letter, acting as the head prosecutor for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: AJN
persons.context: The judge assigned to the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Password Transmission
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends the password for a drive containing discovery materials to the Metropolitan Detention Center for the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is a formal communication from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (docket 20 Cr. 330).
It confirms that discovery materials pertinent to Ghislaine Maxwell's case were stored on a password-protected drive.
The document shows the procedural step of the prosecution providing access to evidence to the detention facility where the defendant was likely held.
